issues.description: Endpoint path naming for Person CRUD operations is inconsistent: the problem statement specifies "/persons", whereas the solution PersonResource defines mappings under "/people" and the solutionâ€™s PersonController mixes both "/people" (for create/update) and "/persons" (for get/delete). This mismatch will break client-server calls and confuse students.
issues.suggested_fix: Use a single consistent path name for Person endpoints across all artifacts. For example, change all mappings in PersonResource to use "/persons" (e.g., @GetMapping("persons"), @PostMapping("persons"), etc.) and update all corresponding URI calls in PersonController to "persons". Ensure problem statement, server mappings, and client URIs all match.

issues.description: The REST endpoint path for person resources is inconsistently named across artifacts. The problem statement and curl examples specify the endpoints under "/persons", but in the solution repository the server-side resource maps to "/people" in PersonResource and the client-side PersonController alternates between "people" (for add/update) and "persons" (for delete/get). This misalignment will confuse students about which URI to implement and call.
issues.suggested_fix: Use a single consistent plural form for the person resource across all artifacts. For example, rename all occurrences of "/people" to "/persons" in both PersonResource and PersonController (add, update, delete, get methods) so they align with the problem statement and each other.
